perturbation.original_text: The Principal appoints the Distributor as a non-exclusive distributor, to sell Principal’s qPCR infectious disease kits, Logix Smart COVID-19 PCR diagnostic test and Co-Dx Box™ instrument (the “Products”). The Products are described on Exhibit A to this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: The Principal appoints the Distributor as a non-exclusive seller, to sell Principal’s qPCR infectious disease kits, Logix Smart COVID-19 PCR diagnostic test and Co-Dx Box™ instrument (the “Products”). The Merchandise are described on Exhibit A to this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'distributor' to 'seller' and 'Products' to 'Merchandise' without defining 'seller' or 'Merchandise' creates confusion. The agreement repeatedly uses 'Distributor' later on, creating a contradiction about the nature of the appointed role. It is uncertain if the role of seller carries the same responsibilities as a distributor.

perturbation.original_text: The Principal grants Distributor non- exclusive rights to sell these products within the countries of Romania (the “Territory”), which may be amended by mutual written agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: The Principal grants Retailer non- exclusive rights to sell these deliverables within the countries of Romania (the “Territory”), which may be amended by mutual written agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Distributor' to 'Retailer' and 'products' to 'deliverables' creates confusion because the rest of the document refers to the appointed party as the 'Distributor'. It creates uncertainty of the nature of the appointed role. The ambiguity around the definition of “deliverables” could lead to disagreements about scope.

perturbation.original_text: The Distributor accepts the appointment and shall use its commercially reasonable efforts to promote, market and sell the Products within the Territory, devote such time and attention as may be reasonably necessary and abide by the Principal’s policies.
perturbation.changed_text: The Vendor accepts the appointment and shall use its commercially reasonable efforts to promote, market and sell the Offerings within the Territory, devote such time and attention as may be reasonably necessary and abide by the Principal’s guidelines.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Distributor' to 'Vendor', 'Products' to 'Offerings' and 'policies' to 'guidelines' creates a contradiction. The contract uses all these terms interchangably. It is unclear if 'Vendor' is responsible for the payment or other responsibilities.
